name: Gambler

effect.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Flip a coin. If heads, draw 8 cards. If tails, draw 1 card.

strengths: Useful when hand is bad anyway
Shuffles dead cards back into deck

competitiveHistory: Gambler was a high-variance draw card that was generally considered inferior to Professor Oak (guaranteed 7 cards without the coin flip risk). However, it saw play in decks that wanted additional draw options beyond Oak or couldn't afford the Oak discard. The possibility of drawing only 1 card made it a risky choice.

rulings.ruling: You must shuffle your entire hand into your deck before flipping the coin.
You must use Gambler even if tails - you cannot choose not to draw the 1 card.
